div1.p: Territory of Washington} In the District Court 4th JuCounty of Spokane}ss dicial District holding terms at County seat of Spokane County
Territory of Washington vs. Plaintiff Ray Raymond Defendant
Territory of Washington} County of Spokane}ss

Thomas C. Griffitts, J. Kennedy Stout, N.T. Caton, and Frederick Stanford being each individually duly sworn depose and swear as follows: That they and each of them are of counsel a attorney for defendant Ray Raymond in this cause that said defendant cannot safely present to trial therein at this time of this court for the following reasons: The indictment against her eas returned herein December 1, 1886, and the defendants plea infered of not guilty on Dec. 1, 1886. That immediately thereafter defendant counsel made a motion for change of venue herein and present the same to the hearing at the earliest time the convenience of the court and counsel for the Territory permitted, and said motion was finally determined and awarded De. 14, 1886, defendant by her counsel immediately
give in there this written for a continuance. That this did question for a change of venue was made by defendant and her counsel in the utmost good faith and they are greatly taken by surprise both by the affidavit filed herein by the territory and on the said motion and at the pending of the same and believing their said motion were taken, they did not show a motion for a continuance herein would be necessary until the final determination of said motion for a change of venue. That would the findind and presentment of the indictment hererin neither affiant nor defendant knew with what crime defendant would be accused nor what the issue herein would be whether she would be accused of any offense whatsoever or of an offense insodoing the issue of malice in the killing of Finch. That at time such indictment was presented this term of this court had duly been in sworn and counsel for defendant had been constant in attendance. Then now and ever since said indictment was returned into the court and defendant counsel herein have been in about constant attendance at this court and expressed either in the trial of counsel therein or in watching
and waiting for the trial of pending course or preparing for the trial of cause such pending in this court and for trial and of pursing importance and still to be tried herein that considerable time since the finding of said indictment have been recopied by defendant counsel in the preparation for and hearing of said motion for a change of venue and since its determination in the preparation of a showing for the continuance; that in addition to their other habeas as afore detailed counsel immediately set about making such preparation as they could under the circumstances for the trial of the cause attending to well aware they could not fully prepare thereupon and in fact counsel believes that the later date in the term when this indictment was presented, the bona fide efforts they had made and the parts directed in the showing for change of venue made by them and which is here referred to as part of the new herein and the continuation of that cas at this causeterm of court and the return of the indictment herein and the great expense and delay of procuring a jury herein at this time, with the facts he afore
States in this affidavit would appear to the direction of this court and precinct there often being compilled to go to trial at this time, that from to the finding of the indictment herin defendant and affiants has said inquiry concerning an George Wycoff who affiant were informed living about 22 miles from Spokane Sea and when affiant had been informed was in defendants' parlor in the night of the killing of Finch, and has been reliably informed that said Wycoff was temporarily absent from his home and from spokane County and about walla walla county somewhere but just when affiant could not hear, that shortly after the finding of the indictment-herein affiant directs a subpoena to issue herein for him, that they use seeking worthy informed he comes with be found and they have only fiaound within this days that he has been found and is somewhere in Spokane years on a petition for the prosecution that said Wycoff is wholly to affiant defendent and her counsel by sight even they are unable to say wherefore in
with he was for in defendant's parlor as aforesaid at time of the killing is what he has of his there can said reviewto on said trial, but affiants have heard that he to have been an eye=witness to the shooting. That since the finding of this indictment- affiant have also learned that the prosecution have still another witness by the name of Donalsm but whose given name is unknown to affaints, and who has not a witness upon the preliminary examination herein for before the 9 rounds jury and whose name is not in the indictment who also claims and intends to swear that he was present at the time that height of the Killing of Finch and who is defendant's parlor at the time and that he was an eye=witness to the shooting. That whether or not says Donalsm was present in defendents parlor at the time of the shooting of Finch affiants do not know of this an knowledge the name heard of that effect except from his statements, but affiants allege that-they are informed for that if he even to juent in said parlor he reconpines a position therein which rendered is impossible for him to see the recarabees leading to and act of shooting of Finch, and that the same fact is true of the said George Wycoff and that he
if present at all in defendant's parlor at time of said killing also position where he comes with see any verify the of fray out of which the killing arose or the act of killing. That within affiant's urn the defendant. Knew until since the finding of this indicment- that- the prosecution had welaimers to house such witness and affiants and camers that the prosecution had produced the witness Wycoff within the last two days. That within affiants urr defendant know fully what the prosecution intends to prove by said witness in the trial of this cause and they are not oufficially aquiantes with said witnesses at this time to be able fully to meet them and guan agaisnt surprise on the trial of the canseat this time affiants have refen to the affidavit of defendant herein filed in support hereof, affiants further allege that they have used ace pursible diligence to prepare to hurt such witnesses since they became aware that the Territory had procunes there and would often their Tichinoury and have been unable to do so,
Affiants further allege as another vthis petition;
That in ip the grounds of defense which they expect to maintain in fact of defendant in their cause is that on the time of insanity at the time of the killing, that defendant is and for many years mental disorder, which and that the same is hereditary in her family, and that-at the time of the killing, going Finch defendant was insane and in such mental condition as to be inegable of committing the crime with which she is charged in this indictment That on the trial of this cause affiants expect to prove by me W. J. Wycoff of og din in The Territory of Utah, That- he has known defendant for about 15 years; That- he was marries to defendant 14 years ago and lived with her 5 or 6 years and by her had two children; That- at the time she was his wife and he living with her as such she was afflicted with the disease of wisamly the same as that with which she was afflicted at the time of the killing alleged in the indictment-herein but the details of what said witness since Diular T. bearing upon this issues affiants cannot fully state, but affiants expect to prove by him the facts above stated and the fact that insanity is a hereditary Trait in defendants family. That was better named
by one of defendants causes in the month of July, 1886 with the inuilare in which the same was eccinueds is presented herwith marked A. B. and made pail of this affidavit That since the finding of this indictment it has been impossible to produce the alledged of said witness words at this time of this enerner to produce a deposition from him even if his deposition wreed be proper and admissible but that from information from and prinde disposition of said witness towards defendant, and from the fact that tdefendant has sufficient money to pay the expense of said witness from ogden after wins to depthand Fracco of the plane upholding their court and the expense of his attendance herein, and that she wise fery the same to procure his attendance all of which is have states as facts, suffiants believes and have reasonable grounds to believe, there they can procure the persual attendance of sad witness at the next term of this court for the trial of this cause-
Affiants further expect to prove and can prove by said witness word that somewhere in her sound minus and I said
intervals defendants is a placeable, kind=hearted woman, ex indingly tinies and everwordly and afaid of assaults on from of any kind and with in any manner given to quaneling or the use of frivamnes, This testimony is mentioned in nice of the fact that- defendant is charged with maliciously and purposely killing James Finch and that is in a fact that said Finch was at the time of the killing of Finch with which she is charged a total stranger to her.
That affiants expect to prove sales technically that same facts as above stating concerning defendants insanity and probable disposition by the process are William Mc Dermott, who is now a resident-of Beetle City,, Montana
